s0101: Now though I am foolish, not matching Zhou's tyranny.
s0102: Yan people though in disorder, not matching Yin people's extremity.
s0103: If the house has words, not fully spoken, to tell the neighbors and villagers.
s0104: These two, I do not do for my lord.
s0105: Yue Xian and Yue Cheng resented Yan not listening to their plans. The two ultimately remained in Zhao.
s0106: Zhao enfeoffed Yue Cheng as Lord Wuxiang.
s0107: The next year, Yue Cheng and Lian Po besieged Yan for Zhao. Yan used heavy ceremony to make peace, then they withdrew.
s0108: Five years later, Zhao King Xiaocheng died.
s0109: King Xiang sent Yue Cheng to replace Lian Po.
s0110: Lian Po attacked Yue Cheng. Yue Cheng fled. Lian Po deserted to Wei.
s0111: Sixteen years later Qin destroyed Zhao.
s0112: Over twenty years later, Gaozu passed through Zhao and asked: 'Does Yue Yi have descendants?'
s0114: Gaozu enfeoffed him as Lord Yue, titled Lord Huacheng.
s0115: Lord Huacheng was Yue Yi's grandson.
s0116: The Yue clan had Lord Yue Xia and Lord Yue Chen. Zhao was about to be destroyed by Qin, they fled to Qi's Gaomi.
s0117: Lord Yue Chen was skilled in the teachings of Yellow Emperor and Laozi, became famous in Qi, called a worthy teacher.
s0118: The Grand Historian says: At first, Qi's Kuai Tong and Lord Father Jian read Yue Yi's letter replying to the Yan king, never failed to put down the book and weep.
s0119: Lord Yue Chen studied Yellow Emperor and Laozi. His original teacher was titled Riverbank Elder, no one knows his origin.
s0120: Riverbank Elder taught An Qisheng, An Qisheng taught Mao Xigong, Mao Xigong taught Lord Yue Xia, Lord Yue Xia taught Lord Yue Chen, Lord Yue Chen taught Gai Gong.
s0121: Gai Gong taught in Qi's Gaomi and Jiaoxi, became teacher to Chancellor Cao.
